contractId.description: Contract ID having Cloud Wrapper entitlement.

locationId.description: Unique identifier of the configured location.

type.description: The type of delivery property you've assigned this capacity to. `MEDIA` applies to live or video on demand content. `WEB_STANDARD_TLS` or `WEB_ENHANCED_TLS` applies to web content using Standard TLS security or Enhanced TLS security, respectively.

unassignedCapacity.description: The total amount of capacity you can assign to Cloud Wrapper configurations.

value.description: The value of capacity.

post.description: Create a Cloud Wrapper configuration. You first need to work with your account team to include Cloud Wrapper locations and capacity on your contract. Verify your capacity by viewing your [capacity inventory](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/get-capacity-inventory).

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Cloud Wrapper Configuration API

schema.description: Creates a Cloud Wrapper configuration.

capacityAlertsThreshold.description: Capacity Alerts enablement information for the configuration.

comments.description: Additional information you provide to differentiate or track changes of the configuration.

configName.description: The name of the configuration (property) you've set up to deliver your content. This is the `propertyName` you set when you [create](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/post-properties) the property.

contractId.description: Contract ID having Cloud Wrapper entitlement.

locations.description: List of locations to use with the configuration. Locations need to have a pre-approved capacity approval for the selected contract.

items.description: Location configuration that describes property and traffic type.

capacity.description: The capacity assigned to this configuration's location. [List capacity](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/get-capacity-inventory) to view the `approvedCapacity` and `assignedCapacity` capacities.

value.description: The value of capacity.

trafficTypeId.description: Unique identifier for the location and traffic type combination. You can [list locations](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/get-locations) to see your available combinations.

multiCdnSettings.description: Specify details about the Multi CDN settings.

advancedSettings.description: Specifies advanced settings. This is only available to Akamai Global Services Support.

amdLiveSetting.description: Settings you've defined in a property to deliver live streaming media using [Adaptive Media Delivery](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/get-started-with-the-cloud-wrapper-configuration-api#3-set-up-a-delivery-configuration).

contentCharacteristicsAMD.description: Specifies characteristics of the delivered content. Akamai uses this information to optimize your metadata configuration, which may result in better origin offload and end-user performance.

segmentDurationDashCustom.description: Customizes the number of seconds for the segment.

segmentDurationHLSCustom.description: Customizes the number of seconds for the segment.

segmentDurationSmoothCustom.description: Customizes the number of seconds for the segment.

segmentSizeDASH.description: Specifies the size of the media object retrieved from the origin. Either `LESS_THAN_1MB`, `ONE_MB_TO_TEN_MB`, `TEN_MB_TO_100_MB`, `GREATER_THAN_100MB`, `OTHER` or `UNKNOWN`.

segmentSizeHLS.description: Specifies the size of the media object retrieved from the origin. Either `LESS_THAN_1MB`, `ONE_MB_TO_TEN_MB`, `TEN_MB_TO_100_MB`, `GREATER_THAN_100MB`, `OTHER` or `UNKNOWN`.

baseDirectory.description: Specifies the [base path](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-base-directory) of content on your origin server.

value.description: Specifies the base path of content on your origin server. The value needs to begin and end with a slash (/) character.

cacheKeyQueryParams.description: Consolidates cached objects based on specified sets of [query parameters](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-cache-key-query-params).

behavior.description: Configure how sets of query string parameters translate to cache keys. See [cacheKeyQueryParams](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-cache-key-query-params) for details on applicable values.

exactMatch.description: When enabled, `parameters` needs to match exactly. Keep disabled to match string prefixes. You can only apply this if `behavior` is set to `INCLUDE` or `IGNORE`.

parameters.description: Specifies the set of parameter field names to include in or exclude from the cache key. By default, these match the field names as string prefixes. You can only apply this if `behavior` is set to `INCLUDE` or `IGNORE`.

denyResponseCode.description: The code of a deny response, either `403` or `429`.

downloadDeliverySetting.description: Settings you've defined in a property to deliver your content using [Download Delivery](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/get-started-with-the-cloud-wrapper-configuration-api#3-set-up-a-delivery-configuration).

objectSize.description: Optimize based on the size of the object retrieved from the origin. Either `LESS_THAN_1MB`, `ONE_MB_TO_TEN_MB`, `TEN_MB_TO_100_MB`, `GREATER_THAN_100MB`, `OTHER` or `UNKNOWN`.

value.description: Specifies the timeout value followed by `s`, `m`, `h`, or `d` for seconds, minutes, hours, or days. This value should never be zero.
Specifies the timeout value followed by `s`, `m`, `h`, or `d` for seconds, minutes, hours, or days. This value should never be zero.

rewriteUrl.description: Modifies the [path](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-base-directory) of incoming requests to forward to your origin server.

behavior.description: The action to perform on the path. Either `REPLACE`, `REMOVE`, `PREPEND`, `REWRITE` or `REGEX_REPLACE`.

keepQueryString.description: Enable this to keep the original path's query parameters. You can't enable this if you've set this behavior to `REWRITE`.

match.description: When the behavior is `REMOVE` or `REPLACE`, this specifies the part of the incoming path you'd like to remove or modify.

matchMultiple.description: When enabled, replaces all potential matches rather than only the first. For this behavior it's either: `REMOVE`, `REPLACE`, or `REGEX_REPLACE`.

matchRegex.description: When the behavior is set to `REGEX_REPLACE`, this specifies the Perl-compatible regular expression to replace with `targetRegex`.

targetPath.description: When the behavior is set to `REPLACE`, this path replaces whatever the match field matches in the incoming request's path.

targetPathPrepend.description: When the behavior is set to `PREPEND`, this specifies a path to prepend to the incoming request's URL.

targetRegex.description: When the behavior is set to `REGEX_REPLACE`, this replaces whatever the `matchRegex` field matches.

targetUrl.description: When the behavior is set to `REWRITE`, this specifies the full path to request from the origin.

bocc.description: Specify diagnostic data beacons details. This enables real-time beaconing for [Broadcast Operations Control Center](https://www.akamai.com/global-services/services/broadcast-operations-command-center).

conditionalSamplingFrequency.description: The sampling frequency of requests and forwards for `EDGE`, `MIDGRESS`, and `ORIGIN` beacons. Set to `ONE_TENTH`, or choose `ZERO` to disable beacons.

enabled.description: Enable diagnostic data beacons for consumption by the [Broadcast Operations Control Center](https://www.akamai.com/global-services/services/broadcast-operations-command-center).

forwardType.description: Select whether to beacon diagnostics data for internal `ORIGIN_ONLY`, `MIDGRESS_ONLY`, or both `ORIGIN_AND_MIDGRESS` forwards.

requestType.description: Select whether to beacon diagnostics data for `EDGE_ONLY` or `EDGE_AND_MIDGRESS` requests.

samplingFrequency.description: The sampling frequency of requests and forwards for `EDGE`, `MIDGRESS`, and `ORIGIN` beacons. Set to `ONE_TENTH`, or choose `ZERO` to disable beacons.

cdns.description: List of CDN added for the configuration.

cdnAuthKeys.description: List of auth keys configured for the CDN.

authKeyName.description: Name of the new auth key.

expiryDate.description: ISO 8601 expiration date of the key.

headerName.description: The header name you want to use for the auth key. If you leave this out, the API uses the name of the third-party CDN you specified via the `cdnCode` in your Cloud Wrapper [configuration](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/post-configuration).

secret.description: A unique, 24 character hexadecimal string to use with CDN auth keys.

cdnCode.description: Unique identifier for the CDN. [List CDN providers](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/get-providers) for a list of available CDNs.

httpsOnly.description: Specify whether CDN communication is HTTPS only.

ipAclCidrs.description: Configure an access control list using IP addresses in CIDR notation. You get a denial of service error if your CDN makes requests from IPs that aren't part of the list configured here. You need to maintain the IP/CIDR list in this configuration to ensure it's up-to-date with your CDN's list. Cloud Wrapper can receive traffic from your downstream CDN using both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses. Include both IPv4 and IPv6 CDN addresses in your ACLs. View the [FAQ](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/docs/faq-and-considerations) for information about setting up auth alerts.

dataStreamIds.description: The unique identifiers Akamai assigns to the DataStreams. Use the [DataStream API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/datastream2/reference/api) to view stream configurations.

samplingRate.description: Specifies the percentage of log data you want to collect for this configuration.

enableSoftAlerts.description: Option to opt out of alerts based on soft limits of bandwidth usage.

origins.description: List of origins corresponding to the properties selected in the configuration.

hostname.description: The origin hostname you've set for your origin server in your Property Manager delivery configuration.

originId.description: The origin identifier that's used to generate Multi CDN hostnames.

propertyId.description: The [Property ID](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/get-properties) of the property the origin belongs to.

notificationEmails.description: Email addresses to use for notifications.

propertyIds.description: A list of identifiers that represents the [properties](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/concepts) eligible to add Cloud Wrapper. To see property specifics, run the [list properties](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/get-properties) operation.

retainIdleObjects.description: By default, idle objects are kept in your footprint for 30 days. Set this to `true` to retain them beyond this 30 day limit. This only applies to [locations](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/get-locations) you've configured with a redundant content `type` like `LIVE_VOD` or `WEB_STANDARD_TLS`.

value.description: The value of capacity.

mapName.description: Name of the map used for the Cloud Wrapper geographic region.

trafficTypeId.description: Unique identifier for the location and traffic type combination. You can run the [list locations](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/get-locations) operation to see your available combinations.

Cloud Wrapper can receive traffic from your downstream CDN using both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses. Include both IPv4 and IPv6 CDN addresses in your ACLs. View the [FAQ](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/docs/faq-and-considerations) for information about setting up auth alerts.

exactMatch.description: When enabled, `parameters` needs to match exactly. Keep disabled to match string prefixes. You can only apply this if `behavior` is set to `INCLUDE` or `IGNORE`.

rewriteUrl.description: Modifies the [path](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-base-directory) of incoming requests to forward to your origin server.

behavior.description: The action to perform on the path. Either `REPLACE`, `REMOVE`, `PREPEND`, `REWRITE` or `REGEX_REPLACE`.

keepQueryString.description: Enable this to keep the original path's query parameters. You can't enable this if you've set this behavior to `REWRITE`.

match.description: When the behavior is `REMOVE` or `REPLACE`, this specifies the part of the incoming path you'd like to remove or modify.

matchMultiple.description: When enabled, replaces all potential matches rather than only the first. For this behavior it's either: `REMOVE`, `REPLACE`, or `REGEX_REPLACE`.

matchRegex.description: When the behavior is set to `REGEX_REPLACE`, this specifies the Perl-compatible regular expression to replace with `targetRegex`.

targetPath.description: When the behavior is set to `REPLACE`, this path replaces whatever the match field matches in the incoming request's path.

targetPathPrepend.description: When the behavior is set to `PREPEND`, this specifies a path to prepend to the incoming request's URL.

targetRegex.description: When the behavior is set to `REGEX_REPLACE`, this replaces whatever the `matchRegex` field matches.

targetUrl.description: When the behavior is set to `REWRITE`, this specifies the full path to request from the origin.

requestType.description: Select whether to beacon diagnostics data for `EDGE_ONLY` or `EDGE_AND_MIDGRESS` requests.

samplingFrequency.description: The sampling frequency of requests and forwards for `EDGE`, `MIDGRESS`, and `ORIGIN` beacons. Set to `ONE_TENTH`, or choose `ZERO` to disable beacons.

post.description:
Activate a Cloud Wrapper configuration. It takes 3-4 hours for the configuration to complete. You can use the configuration's `configId` to run the [Get a configuration](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/get-configuration) operation and review its `status`. Once it's `ACTIVE`, [enable the Cloud Wrapper behavior](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/docs/add-a-cloud-wrapper-behavior#enable-the-cloud-wrapper-behavior) in your property. 

To deactivate a configuration, [update it](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/put-configuration) and set the `activate` query string to `false`.

behavior.description: The action to perform on the path. Either `REPLACE`, `REMOVE`, `PREPEND`, `REWRITE` or `REGEX_REPLACE`.

keepQueryString.description: Enable this to keep the original path's query parameters. You can't enable this if you've set this behavior to `REWRITE`.

match.description: When the behavior is `REMOVE` or `REPLACE`, this specifies the part of the incoming path you'd like to remove or modify.

matchMultiple.description: When enabled, replaces all potential matches rather than only the first. For this behavior it's either: `REMOVE`, `REPLACE`, or `REGEX_REPLACE`.

matchRegex.description: When the behavior is set to `REGEX_REPLACE`, this specifies the Perl-compatible regular expression to replace with `targetRegex`.

targetPath.description: When the behavior is set to `REPLACE`, this path replaces whatever the match field matches in the incoming request's path.

targetPathPrepend.description: When the behavior is set to `PREPEND`, this specifies a path to prepend to the incoming request's URL.

targetRegex.description: When the behavior is set to `REGEX_REPLACE`, this replaces whatever the `matchRegex` field matches.

targetUrl.description: When the behavior is set to `REWRITE`, this specifies the full path to request from the origin.

arlId.description: Unique identifier for the Akamai Resource Locator.

bocc.description: Specify diagnostic data beacons details. It enables real time beaconing for [Broadcast Operations Control Center](https://www.akamai.com/global-services/services/broadcast-operations-command-center).

conditionalSamplingFrequency.description: The sampling frequency of requests and forwards for `EDGE`, `MIDGRESS`, and `ORIGIN` beacons. Set to `ONE_TENTH`, or choose `ZERO` to disable beacons.

enabled.description: Enable diagnostic data beacons for consumption by the [Broadcast Operations Control Center](https://www.akamai.com/global-services/services/broadcast-operations-command-center).

forwardType.description: Select whether to beacon diagnostics data for internal `ORIGIN_ONLY`, `MIDGRESS_ONLY`, or both `ORIGIN_AND_MIDGRESS` forwards.

requestType.description: Select whether to beacon diagnostics data for `EDGE_ONLY` or `EDGE_AND_MIDGRESS` requests.

samplingFrequency.description: The sampling frequency of requests and forwards for `EDGE`, `MIDGRESS`, and `ORIGIN` beacons. Set to `ONE_TENTH`, or choose `ZERO` to disable beacons.

cdns.description: List of CDN added for the configuration.

cdnAuthKeys.description: List of auth keys configured for the CDN.

authKeyName.description: Name of the new auth key.

expiryDate.description: ISO 8601 expiration date of the key.

headerName.description: The header name you want to use for the auth key. If you leave this out, the API uses the name of the third-party CDN you specified via the `cdnCode` in your Cloud Wrapper [configuration](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/post-configuration).

secret.description: A unique, 24 character hexadecimal string to use with CDN auth keys.

cdnCode.description: Unique identifier for the CDN. [List CDN providers](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/get-providers) for a list of available CDNs.

httpsOnly.description: Specify whether CDN communication is HTTPS only.

ipAclCidrs.description: Configure an access control list using IP addresses in CIDR notation. You get a denial of service error if your CDN makes requests from IPs that aren't part of the list configured here. You need to maintain the IP/CIDR list in this configuration to ensure it's up-to-date with your CDN's list. Cloud Wrapper can receive traffic from your downstream CDN using both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses. Include both IPv4 and IPv6 CDN addresses in your ACLs. View the [FAQ](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/docs/faq-and-considerations) for information about setting up auth alerts.

dataStreamIds.description: The unique identifiers Akamai assigns to the DataStreams. Use the [DataStream API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/datastream2/reference/api) to view stream configurations.

samplingRate.description: Specifies the percentage of log data you want to collect for this configuration.

enableSoftAlerts.description: Option to opt out of alerts based on soft limits of bandwidth usage.

origins.description: List of origins corresponding to the properties selected in the configuration.

hostname.description: The origin hostname you've set for your origin server in your Property Manager delivery configuration.

originId.description: The origin identifier that's used to generate Multi CDN hostnames.

propertyId.description: The [Property ID](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/get-properties) of the property the origin belongs to.

propertyIds.description: List of [properties](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/concepts) belonging to eligible delivery products.

retainIdleObjects.description: Retain idle objects beyond their max idle lifetime.

baseDirectory.description: Specifies the [base path](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-base-directory) of content on your origin server.

value.description: Specifies the base path of content on your origin server. The value needs to begin and end with a slash (/) character.

cacheKeyQueryParams.description: Consolidates cached objects based on specified sets of [query parameters](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-cache-key-query-params).

behavior.description: Configure how sets of query string parameters translate to cache keys. See [cacheKeyQueryParams](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-cache-key-query-params) for details on applicable values.

exactMatch.description: When enabled, `parameters` needs to match exactly. Keep disabled to match string prefixes. You can only apply this if `behavior` is set to `INCLUDE` or `IGNORE`.

parameters.description: Specifies the set of parameter field names to include in or exclude from the cache key. By default, these match the field names as string prefixes. You can only apply this if `behavior` is set to `INCLUDE` or `IGNORE`.

denyResponseCode.description: The code of a deny response, either `403` or `429`.

downloadDeliverySetting.description: Settings you've defined in a property to deliver your content using [Download Delivery](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/get-started-with-the-cloud-wrapper-configuration-api#3-set-up-a-delivery-configuration).

contentCharacteristicsDD.description: Specifies characteristics of the delivered content. Akamai uses this information to optimize your metadata configuration, which may result in better origin offload and end-user performance.

objectSize.description: Optimize based on the size of the object retrieved from the origin. Either `LESS_THAN_1MB`, `ONE_MB_TO_TEN_MB`, `TEN_MB_TO_100_MB`, `GREATER_THAN_100MB`, `OTHER` or `UNKNOWN`.

objectDeliverySetting.description: Settings you've defined in a property to deliver your content using [Object Delivery](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/get-started-with-the-cloud-wrapper-configuration-api#3-set-up-a-delivery-configuration).

readTimeout.description: After a requesting forward server has established a connection with an edge server, this specifies how long the edge server should wait for a response.

rewriteUrl.description: Modifies the [path](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-base-directory) of incoming requests to forward to your origin server.

behavior.description: The action to perform on the path. Either `REPLACE`, `REMOVE`, `PREPEND`, `REWRITE` or `REGEX_REPLACE`.

keepQueryString.description: Enable this to keep the original path's query parameters. You can't enable this if you've set this behavior to `REWRITE`.

match.description: When the behavior is `REMOVE` or `REPLACE`, this specifies the part of the incoming path you'd like to remove or modify.

matchMultiple.description: When enabled, replaces all potential matches rather than only the first. For this behavior it's either: `REMOVE`, `REPLACE`, or `REGEX_REPLACE`.

matchRegex.description: When the behavior is set to `REGEX_REPLACE`, this specifies the Perl-compatible regular expression to replace with `targetRegex`.

targetPath.description: When the behavior is set to `REPLACE`, this path replaces whatever the match field matches in the incoming request's path.

targetPathPrepend.description: When the behavior is set to `PREPEND`, this specifies a path to prepend to the incoming request's URL.

targetRegex.description: When the behavior is set to `REGEX_REPLACE`, this replaces whatever the `matchRegex` field matches.

targetUrl.description: When the behavior is set to `REWRITE`, this specifies the full path to request from the origin.

arlId.description: Unique identifier for the Akamai Resource Locator.

bocc.description: Specify diagnostic data beacons details. It enables real time beaconing for [Broadcast Operations Control Center](https://www.akamai.com/global-services/services/broadcast-operations-command-center).

conditionalSamplingFrequency.description: The sampling frequency of requests and forwards for `EDGE`, `MIDGRESS`, and `ORIGIN` beacons. Set to `ONE_TENTH`, or choose `ZERO` to disable beacons.

enabled.description: Enable diagnostic data beacons for consumption by the [Broadcast Operations Control Center](https://www.akamai.com/global-services/services/broadcast-operations-command-center).

forwardType.description: Select whether to beacon diagnostics data for internal `ORIGIN_ONLY`, `MIDGRESS_ONLY`, or both `ORIGIN_AND_MIDGRESS` forwards.

requestType.description: Select whether to beacon diagnostics data for `EDGE_ONLY` or `EDGE_AND_MIDGRESS` requests.

samplingFrequency.description: The sampling frequency of requests and forwards for `EDGE`, `MIDGRESS`, and `ORIGIN` beacons. Set to `ONE_TENTH`, or choose `ZERO` to disable beacons.

cdns.description: List of CDN added for the configuration.

cdnAuthKeys.description: List of auth keys configured for the CDN.

authKeyName.description: Name of the new auth key.

expiryDate.description: ISO 8601 expiration date of the key.

headerName.description: The header name you want to use for the auth key. If you leave this out, the API uses the name of the third-party CDN you specified via the `cdnCode` in your Cloud Wrapper [configuration](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/post-configuration).

secret.description: A unique, 24 character hexadecimal string to use with CDN auth keys.

cdnCode.description: Unique identifier for the CDN. [List CDN providers](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/get-providers) for a list of available CDNs.

httpsOnly.description: Specify whether CDN communication is HTTPS only.

ipAclCidrs.description: Configure an access control list using IP addresses in CIDR notation. You get a denial of service error if your CDN makes requests from IPs that aren't part of the list configured here. You need to maintain the IP/CIDR list in this configuration to ensure it's up-to-date with your CDN's list. Cloud Wrapper can receive traffic from your downstream CDN using both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses. Include both IPv4 and IPv6 CDN addresses in your ACLs. View the [FAQ](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/docs/faq-and-considerations) for information about setting up auth alerts.

dataStreamIds.description: The unique identifiers Akamai assigns to the DataStreams. Use the [DataStream API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/datastream2/reference/api) to view stream configurations.

samplingRate.description: Specifies the percentage of log data you want to collect for this configuration.

enableSoftAlerts.description: Option to opt out of alerts based on soft limits of bandwidth usage.

origins.description: List of origins corresponding to the properties selected in the configuration.

hostname.description: The origin hostname you've set for your origin server in your Property Manager delivery configuration.

originId.description: The origin identifier that's used to generate Multi CDN hostnames.

propertyId.description: The [Property ID](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/get-properties) of the property the origin belongs to.

propertyIds.description: List of [properties](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/concepts) belonging to eligible delivery products.

retainIdleObjects.description: Retain idle objects beyond their max idle lifetime.

status.description: Current provisioning state of the configuration, either `SAVED`, `IN_PROGRESS`, `ACTIVE`, `DELETE_IN_PROGRESS`, or `FAILED`.

delete.description:
Delete a specific Cloud Wrapper configuration. The delete can take up to three hours to complete. You can use the configuration's `configId` to run the [Get a configuration](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/get-configuration) operation to check the status. `DELETE_IN_PROGRESS` indicates the request has been accepted. A 404 response indicates the configuration has been deleted. Before you delete a configuration:
>
> Ensure that all the properties that use it have the [`cloudWrapper`](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-cloud-wrapper) behavior disabled. Then [update](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloud-wrapper/reference/put-configuration) the configuration to deactivate it by setting the `activate` query string to `false`.

items.description: Describes Cloud Wrapper traffic types and region maps.

mapName.description: The name of the map used for the Cloud Wrapper geographic region.

trafficType.description: Represents the traffic type. `LIVE` applies to low latency media traffic, such as live content. `LIVE_VOD` applies to redundant media traffic, such as video on demand content. `WEB_STANDARD_TLS` or `WEB_ENHANCED_TLS` applies to web content using Standard TLS security or Enhanced TLS security, respectively.

trafficTypeId.description: The unique identifier Akamai assigned to the location and traffic type combination in your Cloud Wrapper footprint.

get.description: View a list of properties for delivery products that are eligible to enable Cloud Wrapper.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Cloud Wrapper Configuration API

200.description: The response includes a list of eligible properties.

schema.description: Eligible properties that don't have Cloud Wrapper enabled.

properties.description: A list of all eligible properties that don't have Cloud Wrapper enabled.

contractId.description: The unique identifier Akamai assigned to your [contract](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/docs/key-concepts-terms#content-structure), where you've added Cloud Wrapper.

groupId.description: The unique identifier Akamai assigned to the [group](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/docs/key-concepts-terms#content-structure) you used to create the property.

propertyId.description: The unique identifier Akamai assigned to the property you've configured to deliver your media or website content.

propertyName.description: The name of the property you've configured to deliver your media or website content.

type.description: The type of property. `MEDIA` applies to streaming video or downloadable content. `WEB` applies to website content. A `MEDIA` property can't use the same Cloud Wrapper configuration as a `WEB` property.

get.description: View a list of [origin](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-origin) servers configured in eligible delivery properties. Response data is pulled from the property as its shown in PAPI. At least one origin server entry is shown at the top-level for the `default` rule. If additional origin servers are set in child-level rules in the same property, they're revealed at a lower level.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Cloud Wrapper Configuration API

200.description: The response returns a list of origin servers.

schema.description: Describes your property's `origin` behaviors and child rules.

children.description: Represents child rules in a property.

behaviors.description: This represents the origin behaviors in the rule.

hostname.description: The origin `hostname` you've set in your property for your [origin server](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-origin). Akamai edge servers use this to retrieve your content, to include it in your Cloud Wrapper cache. This only applies if `originType` is set to `CUSTOMER`.

originType.description: The type of [origin server](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-origin) you're using to distribute your content. With Cloud Wrapper, you can use `CUSTOMER` for a custom origin server or `NET_STORAGE` to use NetStorage.

children.description: This represents child-level rules in your property.

items.description: This is a nested property object.

name.description: The name of the property rule.

default.description: Represents the `origin` behavior in a default rule.

hostname.description: The origin `hostname` you've set in your property for your [origin server](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-origin). Akamai edge servers use this to retrieve your content, to include it in your Cloud Wrapper cache. This only applies if `originType` is set to `CUSTOMER`.

originType.description: The type of [origin server](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-origin) you're using to distribute your content. With Cloud Wrapper, you can use `CUSTOMER` for a custom origin server or `NET_STORAGE` to use NetStorage.
